descript.abstract: Parcel boundaries and identifiers developed from City of Melrose 40 scale assessors tax maps. Both map sets were in good condition. Parcel GIS was brought up-to-date using city assessing records and plans. Data was originally developed in 2003 and updated in 2011, 2016, and 2019

idinfo.accconst: This digital parcel data layer is considered to be in the public domain and will become accessible for download and display from the MassGIS website: http://www.mass.gov/mgis
idinfo.useconst: This data may be appropriate for planning purposes. It should not be utilized where legal and surveyed property boundaries are required.
idinfo.native: This parcel data is submitted to MassGIS in a file geodatabase. It will be incorporated into the MassGIS SDE database, and may be converted into other GIS data types for future distribution.
idinfo.datacred: City of Melrose, CDM Smith, MassGIS

dataqual.logic: This parcel layer contains discrete, non-overlapping polygons for each property. Adjacent polygons with common ownership and a single tax record have been retained in the "OthLeg" layer that accompanies this TaxPar layer, and dissolved into single parcels in this TaxPar layer. Some non-adjacent parcels may be represented by multi-part polygons where they share common ownership and a single tax record. Public rights-of-way (ROWs) exist as polygons, not null space. Linework associated with private ROWs are retained in the "OthLeg" layer. Water polygons also representing parcel boundaries have been retained in this TaxPar layer. Additional water features that are not considered parcel boundaries may have been placed in the "Misc" layer that accompanies this TaxPar layer. Easements and other similar non-fee taxable boundaries exist in the 'OthLeg" layer, not the TaxPar layer.

attracc.attraccr: Match rate for "FEE"/"TAX" parcels to assessor table: 99.4 pct

horizpa.horizpar: Original data compiled or reviewed for horizontal accuracy over the MassGIS color orthos from 2008/2009; these orthos are known to be +/- 10' horizontal; however, this data set cannot be used to reach authoritative conclusions about the horizontal accuracy of the boundaries depicted. That work requires a licensed land surveyor. Any updates to this data have been compiled on more recent orthophotography, base maps, or digital plans.

srcinfo.srccontr: Parcel boundaries developed from City of Melrose 40 scale assessors tax maps. Original maps developed by city engineering department, were of very good quality, and has been supported by subsequent surveys. Paper maps were in good condition. Parcel GIS was originally developed in 2003 and was updated using city records and plans in 2011. City has maintained the parcels through 2016.

procstep.procdesc: Data was processed to meet MassGIS Level III formatting standards including reviewing the city boundary and adding standard fields and definitions. Gaps representing street ROWs were filled in as per the Level III requirements.

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: Area of feature in internal units squared.

attrdomv.udom: Positive real numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: Parcel ID that appears on the assessor map.

MassGIS Standard for Digital Parcel Files - v2.1
attr.attrdef: Concatenation of X and Y coordinates of a point inside the polygon.

attr.attrdefs: MassGIS Standard for Digital Parcel Files - v2.1
attr.attrdef: Identifies the kind of polygon in the tax parcel layer.

overview.dsoverv: Parcel boundaries developed from City of Melrose 40 scale assessors tax maps. Original maps developed by city engineering department, were of very good quality, and has been supported by subsequent surveys. Paper maps were in good condition. Parcel GIS was originally developed in 2003 and was updated using city records and plans in 2011. The City has maintained the data through 2016.
overview.eaover:
For a full description of the features and attributes contained in this data, please refer to the MassGIS Standard for Digital Parcel Files - v2.1.
http://www.mass.gov/anf/research-and-tech/it-serv-and-support/application-serv/office-of-geographic-information-massgis/standards/standard-parcels.html

cordsysn.projcsn: NAD 1983 Massachusetts Mainland State Plane Coordinate System, FIPS 2001, US Feet

cntorgp.cntorg: Massachusetts Office of Geographic Information, Commonwealth of Massachusetts

distinfo.distliab: This parcel data is in the public domain and should not be redistributed for a fee beyond reproduction costs.

onlinopt.accinstr: Click on the "Download this layer" link to access all digital parcels.

distinfo.custom: Upon compliance with level 3 of the MassGIS Standard for Digital Parcel Files, this data will be made available for download on the MassGIS website: http://www.mass.gov/anf/research-and-tech/it-serv-and-support/application-serv/office-of-geographic-information-massgis/datalayers/l3parcels.html
distinfo.resdesc: M178TaxPar represents a version of digital municipal parcels for the community of Melrose that is considered ‘level 3’ compliant per the specifications outlined in the MassGIS Standard for Digital Parcel Files. Its features can be linked in a GIS or database environment to a set of standardized assessing attributes in the table M178Assess by using the unique identifying values in the LOC_ID field. This data is also intended to be used in conjunction with associated (and optional) features in the ancillary data layers M178OthLeg and M178Misc. As one of the data sets identified by Massachusetts’ Strategic Plan for Spatial Data Infrastructure (http://www.mass.gov/anf/research-and-tech/it-serv-and-support/application-serv/office-of-geographic-information-massgis/about-massgis/massgis-strategic-plan.htmll), this data enters the public domain as a valuable resource for mapping, planning, and analysis at all levels of government as well as the private sector.

metainfo.metstdn: FGDC Content Standards for Digital Geospatial Metadata

distorCont.rpOrgName: Massachusetts Office of Geographic Information, Commonwealth of Massachusetts

onLineSrc.orDesc: Click on the "Download this layer" link to access all digital parcels.

M178TaxPar represents a version of digital municipal parcels for the community of Melrose that is considered ‘level 3’ compliant per the specifications outlined in the MassGIS Standard for Digital Parcel Files. Its features can be linked in a GIS or database environment to a set of standardized assessing attributes in the table M178Assess by using the unique identifying values in the LOC_ID field. This data is also intended to be used in conjunction with associated (and optional) features in the ancillary data layers M178OthLeg and M178Misc. As one of the data sets identified by Massachusetts’ Strategic Plan for Spatial Data Infrastructure (http://www.mass.gov/anf/research-and-tech/it-serv-and-support/application-serv/office-of-geographic-information-massgis/about-massgis/massgis-strategic-plan.htmll), this data enters the public domain as a valuable resource for mapping, planning, and analysis at all levels of government as well as the private sector.

dataIdInfo.idAbs: Parcel boundaries and identifiers developed from City of Melrose 40 scale assessors tax maps. Both map sets were in good condition. Parcel GIS was brought up-to-date using city assessing records and plans. Data was originally developed in 2003 and updated in 2011, 2016, 2019, 2020, 2022, 2023, 2024, and 2025.
dataIdInfo.idCredit: City of Melrose, CDM Smith, MassGIS

LegConsts.useLimit: This parcel data is in the public domain and should not be redistributed for a fee beyond reproduction costs.

Consts.useLimit: This data may be appropriate for planning purposes. It should not be utilized where legal and surveyed property boundaries are required.

report.measDesc: This parcel layer contains discrete, non-overlapping polygons for each property. Adjacent polygons with common ownership and a single tax record have been retained in the "OthLeg" layer that accompanies this TaxPar layer, and dissolved into single parcels in this TaxPar layer. Some non-adjacent parcels may be represented by multi-part polygons where they share common ownership and a single tax record. Public rights-of-way (ROWs) exist as polygons, not null space. Linework associated with private ROWs are retained in the "OthLeg" layer. Water polygons also representing parcel boundaries have been retained in this TaxPar layer. Additional water features that are not considered parcel boundaries may have been placed in the "Misc" layer that accompanies this TaxPar layer. Easements and other similar non-fee taxable boundaries exist in the 'OthLeg" layer, not the TaxPar layer.
Match rate for "FEE"/"TAX" parcels to assessor table: 99.4 pct

Original data compiled or reviewed for horizontal accuracy over the MassGIS color orthos from 2008/2009; these orthos are known to be +/- 10' horizontal; however, this data set cannot be used to reach authoritative conclusions about the horizontal accuracy of the boundaries depicted. That work requires a licensed land surveyor. Any updates to this data have been compiled on more recent orthophotography, base maps, or digital plans.

prcStep.stepDesc: Data was processed to meet MassGIS Level III formatting standards including reviewing the city boundary and adding standard fields and definitions. Gaps representing street ROWs were filled in as per the Level III requirements.

dataSource.srcDesc: Parcel boundaries developed from City of Melrose 40 scale assessors tax maps. Original maps developed by city engineering department, were of very good quality, and has been supported by subsequent surveys. Paper maps were in good condition. Parcel GIS was originally developed in 2003 and was updated using city records and plans in 2011. City has maintained the parcels through 2016.
